text: my name is Tim Bogart chief technology
officer at the Bastrop real media group
and we are active in Belgium the
Netherlands and Denmark we were active
in newspapers and magazines so that was
our core business and we were really
transforming to a digital world what we
noticed in in our own data centers and
when we were running our idea it was an
organization within our own data centers
we had a lot of shared components really
slowed down our process of delivery and
so our squats we're constantly dependent
on changes that were happening that they
actually didn't manage and the shared
component a general database based
cluster had to agree so everyone was
affected 50 applications were affected
and they had to shift in that prayer
priority within our organisation and
that made it really difficult to go
faster and keep the pace so that's why
we really changed to a cloud model also
the transparency on cost we had a lot of
legacy applications which were running
and it made it very difficult to see
what really made what cost because we
had central storage central database
clusters and and so we didn't recreate
anything we we didn't shut anything down
by making a transparent it really is
easier for us to remove legacy software
that isn't use anymore but was a real
big cost to the company currently we're
doing the strategy of 12 points we try
to isolate
applications that are moving to the
girls and making them really cloud
native we chose AWS because it looked
for us as the most mature one and it's
really going for us so you have that
parallel evolution
the most important benefit I think is
experiment you really can experiment
very fast without upfront costs so we
try something with challenges we
validate it and then we implement it for
widgets that's really important and
another key topic on on AWS which makes
it possible and we will never been able
to before to experiment that fast
[Music]
